1.text: And Jehovah answered Job and said,

2.text: Shall he that will contend with the Almighty instruct [him]? he that reproveth +God, let him answer it.

3.text: And Job answered Jehovah and said,

4.text: Behold, I am nought: what shall I answer thee? I will lay my hand upon my mouth.

5.text: Once have I spoken, and I will not answer; yea twice, but I will proceed no further.

6.text: And Jehovah answered Job out of the whirlwind and said,

7.text: Gird up now thy loins like a man: I will demand of thee, and inform thou me.

8.text: Wilt thou also annul my judgment? wilt thou condemn me that thou mayest be righteous?

9.text: Hast thou an arm like God? or canst thou thunder with a voice like him?

10.text: Deck thyself now with glory and excellency, and clothe thyself with majesty and splendour.

11.text: Cast abroad the ragings of thine anger, and look on every one that is proud, and abase him:

12.text: Look on every one that is proud, bring him low, and tread down the wicked in their place:

13.text: Hide them in the dust together; bind their faces in secret.

14.text: Then will I also praise thee, because thy right hand saveth thee.

15.text: See now the behemoth, which I made with thee: he eateth grass as an ox.

16.text: Behold now, his strength is in his loins, and his force is in the muscles of his belly.

17.text: He bendeth his tail like a cedar; the sinews of his thighs are woven together.

18.text: His bones are tubes of bronze, his members are like bars of iron.

19.text: He is the chief of God’s ways: he that made him gave him his sword.

20.text: For the mountains bring him forth food, where all the beasts of the field play.

21.text: He lieth under lotus-bushes, in the covert of the reed and fen:

22.text: Lotus-bushes cover him with their shade; the willows of the brook surround him.

23.text: Lo, the river overfloweth—he startleth not: he is confident though a Jordan break forth against his mouth.

24.text: Shall he be taken in front? will they pierce through [his] nose in the trap?
